info:
Formation: Future tense of the auxiliary verb "haber" + past participle of the main verb.
Example: "Habré comido" (I will have eaten).
Usage: Used to indicate that an action will be completed before another action or a specific time in the future. Often used with time expressions like "para entonces" (by then), "cuando" (when), etc.
native_answer: By the end of the day, she will have gotten a gift for her friend.
prompt: Para el final del día, ella ______ un regalo para su amiga.
answer: Para el final del día, ella habrá conseguido un regalo para su amiga.

info:

Usage: Used to indicate that an action will be completed before another action or a specific time in the future. Often used with time expressions like "para entonces" (by then), "cuando" (when), etc.
native_answer: By tomorrow morning, they will have left on a trip to the mountains.
prompt: Para mañana por la mañana, ellos ______ de viaje a las montañas.
answer: Para mañana por la mañana, ellos habrán salido de viaje a las montañas.
